item.title: Spatial patterns of the 2015 West African Ebola outbreak

item.title: Statistical and epidemiological consulting
item.description: I work as a freelance statistical consultant. I have worked with clients from private industrial firms, academics, professionals, and undergraduate and graduate students. I have performed data analysis on a contract basis; I have offered statistical advice and guidance to individuals working on theses, grants, and projects; and I have offered individulized statistical and programming assistance and tutoring. My specalizations are in spatial-temporal modelling, environmental statistics, predictive analytics including machine learning approaches, Bayesian inference and computation (MCMC, INLA) and data visulization including interactive app development.

item.title: Recent publications
item.description: Zinszer K, Morrison K, Brownstein JS, Marinho F, Santos AF, Nsoesie EO. Reconstruction of zika virus introduction in Brazil. Emerging Infectious Diseases, 23(1):91, 2017. Zinszer K, Morrison K, Verma A, Brownstein JS.2017. Spatial determinants of Ebola virus disease risk for the West African epidemic. PLoS Currents, 9. Zinszer K, Morrison K, Anema A, Majumder MS, Brownstein JS. 2015. The velocity of ebola spread in parts of west africa. The Lancet Infectious Diseases.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: About
item.description: My training is in biostatistics, epidemiology, and geographic information science. I finished my PhD in February 2017. I currently split my time between three major roles: as a private statistical consultant, as a post-doctoral research at McGill University with Dr. Robert Platt, and as a research analyst at the University of Montreal with Dr. Kate Zinszer. Methodologically, I’m interested in Bayesian approaches to spatio-temporal methods, Bayesian computation, and modern approaches to data visulization.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
